topic.title: Go beyond the 10MB limit
topic.body:
Hello guys,

Do you go past the 10MB uploading limit to your /data/ folder just by changing the limit in the right-hand menu on your Zeronet, or is there something else?

topic.title: what causes the message "file update failed" ?

1_1DqP4N3Nxp9RQQGuqrX5eCqE6t3gWNJXr.body:
> [angristan](#comment_85_1MEWJRMLgvofqG9Mbsb2Rc4hFFyv7HeRx7): When a zerosite needs more than 10MB, you'll get an alert

The thing is, I put a bunch of files in the data folder then I "confirmed" (so as to say) in the terminal in order to update the site, but the terminal stopped updating when it reached 10MB. Is there any way to go past that? Thanks

> [ks](#comment_91_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): I'd say that you can change your local limit to whatever you need. Then it's up to your readers / seeders to accept the higher limit (they'll be prompted).
> You can also make some or all of your files optional.

Are the users prompted even if they access the site without knowing it's even a Zeronet site? (by using enabling them to access the site via a proxy for example) ?

> [ks](#comment_92_14TDWFVHuTXNcg8pp6LRr7v9ZcfbFsMSyx): I don't know how it works if users are accessing the site through a proxy (since it's not their own storage), but they are prompted if they access zeronet directly.
Thanks!
Perhaps someone else can provide an answer?

2_1DqP4N3Nxp9RQQGuqrX5eCqE6t3gWNJXr.body:
> [oracle](#comment_173_1ED3Ho3kmzaKiECtyuqSjDpoE47rKuXeP): I'm getting that now with ZeroMail for some reason.

I usually update my Zeronet site with several dozen of files, they all get updated except a few of them. There's no way to know which ones didn't make it, and the reason why. Any insight?
